text:
Bentley is a city in Sedgwick County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 530 people lived there.
History.
Bentley was planned out in 1888. This was when the Kansas Midland Railway was built to that point. It was named after Orsemus Hills Bentley, a railroad official.
The first post office in Bentley was created in March 1888.
Geography.
Bentley is at (37.886437, -97.517133). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 530 people, 199 households, and 142 families living in Bently.
